intro: Orthogramma gilliesii, commonly known as the Gillies' rockmoss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial plant that typically grows on rocky substrates in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a thalloid structure with a prostrate, lobed leaf-like body that is green and often covered in a layer of fine, white hairs. Orthogramma gilliesii is characterized by its distinctive leaf arrangement and the presence of specialized structures called pseudoparaphyllia. It is found primarily in the southern regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina.
